attributes.magic: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered ransomware. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:116; sid:58; rev:2; msg:"(tcp) experimental TCP options found"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type decode; classtype:protocol-command-decode;)

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This is a Linux ransomware sample identified as a variant of the Qilin ransomware family. It contains a ransom note explicitly mentioning the Qilin group and threatening to publish exfiltrated data. The binary is designed to encrypt files on the local filesystem and specifically targets VMWare ESXi environments. It traverses directories known to contain valuable data (e.g., `/data`, `/backup`, `/var/lib/mysql`, `/var/lib/vmware`) while excluding critical system directories. Malicious behaviors include executing ESXi-specific commands (`esxcli`, `vmkfstools`, `vim-cmd`) to delete virtual machine snapshots to prevent recovery, and modifying `/etc/motd` to display the ransom note. IOCs include the onion URLs `kbsqoivihgdmwczmxkbovk7ss2dcynitwhhfu5yw725dboqo5kthfaad.onion` and `ijzn3sicrcy7guixkzjkib4ukbiilwc3xhnmby4mcbccnsd7j2rekvqd.onion`.
